meanings.definition: The act of renouncing or relinquishing a throne or power.
meanings.sent1: After the king's abdications, his son became the new ruler.
meanings.sent2: The abdications of the queen shocked the entire kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The abdications of the old king led to a comical mix-up in the royal court.
meanings.sent4: Her abdications of power left a void in the kingdom's leadership.
meanings.sent5: The abdications of the tyrant brought freedom to the oppressed people.

meanings.definition: The act of giving up a responsibility or duty.
meanings.sent1: His abdications of his duties at work caused chaos in the office.
meanings.sent2: The abdications of the teacher's responsibilities affected the students' learning.
meanings.sent3: The abdications of the dog from guarding the house led to a funny situation.
meanings.sent4: Her abdications of her role as team leader left her colleagues in a lurch.
meanings.sent5: The abdications of the mayor's duties resulted in a city-wide crisis.
